m1.title: Learning
m1.info:
Referred/deferred examinations are taken in the summer outside of term and occur on exception circumstances.

There are only two terms per year

Changing forgotten passwords will be easier to do on campus,
at home or anywhere with an internet connection.

Once you are connected to the internet visit password.westminster.ac.uk,
enter your username and select the forgotten password link.
An email will then be sent to the alternate email address you provided in SRSWeb.
Go to your alternate email address and select the link to reset your password.

Once your forgotten password is reset,
you will need to wait a
while
for your password details to be synchronised across services such as Blackboard,
SRSWeb,
Google Apps etc.
Synchronisation may take up to an hour especially during busy periods.
The password.westminster.ac.uk online service has also been updated to provide you with links to information on how to connect to the University� s wireless network;IT help contacts;and information on IT Security.

It takes both knowledge and effor to succeed. Without effort one cant gain the knowledge and without knowledge one cant make an effort.

Hint* Find a professor to ask before you answer

m2.title: Services
m2.info:
Laptops can be borrowed for a period of 24 hours.

Dialling 5488 will allow you to contact fixit andget further technical support

Booking study rooms
Cavendish,
Marylebone and Regent Libraries

You can now book group study rooms at our libraries at Cavendish,
Marylebone and Regent Campus,
using the booking service available through Timetabling.

Download our step - by - step room bookings guide
Log in to Timetabling to book a room.

m3.title: Facilities
m3.info:
There are 5 silent study group rooms in the Cavendish library

Booking study rooms
Cavendish,
Marylebone and Regent Libraries

You can now book group study rooms at our libraries at Cavendish,
Marylebone and Regent Campus,
using the booking service available through Timetabling.

Download our step - by - step room bookings guide
Log in to Timetabling to book a room

Rooms can be booked
for the current week and a week in advance.

If your booked room is not in use within 15 minutes of your booked time,
it will become available to other students.If you no longer need a room make sure you log in to the system and cancel your booking.

Each study group:

Should consist of at least 3 people
Can book a room
for up to 2 hours a day
Can book
for a maximum of 4 hours a week

The silent study area located in Cavendish library is on the fifth floor.

There are 5 silent study group rooms in the Cavendish library.

m4.title: Course
m4.info:
Typically 120 credits is the minimum in a year of study

The minimum credits per module is 15

Blackboard submissions are usually due on Mondays by 10am
